tasks.Name: snATAC-seq Peak Calling with MACS2
tasks.Description: Identify regions of open chromatin from snATAC-seq data by calling peaks using MACS2 (Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq). The input is aligned reads, and the output consists of genomic coordinates for called peaks that represent accessible chromatin regions.

tasks.Name: snATAC-seq Quality Control and Filtering
tasks.Description: Apply quality control metrics to snATAC-seq data to filter out low-quality cells, removing cells with a low number of fragments in peaks, issues with nucleosome banding, or enrichment at transcription start sites. The input is the raw snATAC-seq data, and the output will be a filtered data set consisting of the remaining cells.

tasks.Name: snATAC-seq Data Normalization and Dimensionality Reduction
tasks.Description: Normalize snATAC-seq data using TF-IDF (term frequency-inverse document frequency). Reduce dimensionality using Singular Value Decomposition (SVD or LSI). The input consists of the filtered peak-calling counts, and the output includes the normalized and dimensionally reduced data.

tasks.Name: scRNA-seq Data Normalization and Dimensionality Reduction
tasks.Description: Normalize gene expression data to account for sequencing depth differences using SCTransform. Reduce the dimensionality of the data using principal component analysis (PCA). The inputs are raw scRNA-seq gene expression data, and the outputs are normalized and dimensionally reduced data.

tasks.Name: Cell Type Annotation using scRNA-seq
tasks.Description: Label cells in snRNA-seq experiments with reference to known markers from curated literature or databases.

tasks.Name: Differential Chromatin Accessibility Analysis (DAC) using FindMarkers
tasks.Description: Identify differentially accessible chromatin regions (DACRs) between two groups of cells using the FindMarkers function. Logistic regression is performed to detect DACRs, using various parameters, including the minimum percentage and log fold change threshold. The input is snATAC-seq data, along with a grouping of cells. The output is a table indicating DACRs between the groups.

tasks.Name: snRNA-seq Differential Expression Analysis with FindMarkers
tasks.Description: Identify differentially expressed genes (DEGs) between two groups of cells. This is done using a Wilcoxon rank-sum test, adjusting for multiple testing. The input is the normalized scRNA-seq data and the cell grouping. Output is a table of DEGs.

tasks.Name: Gene Regulatory Network (GRN) Analysis Using SCENIC
tasks.Description: Construct gene regulatory networks (GRNs) to identify TF-target gene interactions to determine the regulons active in each cell type. The SCENIC pipeline is used for the various steps.

tasks.Name: snATAC-seq peak annotation with ChIPseeker
tasks.Description: Annotate identified peaks with genomic features - e.g. promoters, or enhancers. Also, it can be annotated with annotations from existing track data.

tasks.Name: snRNA-seq Data Preprocessing, Quality Control, and Filtering using Seurat
tasks.Description: This task involves processing raw snRNA-seq data to filter out low-quality cells and genes. This includes removing cells with high mitochondrial gene content, filtering based on the number of detected genes, and normalization. The outcome is a processed dataset suitable for downstream analysis.

tasks.Name: Dimensionality Reduction and Clustering of snRNA-seq Data using Seurat with Harmony Integration
tasks.Description: This task entails reducing the dimensionality of the processed snRNA-seq data using Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and then performing unsupervised clustering to identify cell populations. The Harmony algorithm may be applied to integrate data from multiple batches. UMAP can be used for visualization.

tasks.Name: Differential Gene Expression Analysis using FindMarkers() in Seurat
tasks.Description: This task performs differential gene expression (DGE) analysis between different cell clusters or conditions (e.g., AKI vs. Ref) to identify genes that are significantly up- or downregulated. Specific methods include using the FindMarkers function within the Seurat package focusing on a certain log2 fold change and p-value threshold.

tasks.Name: Functional Enrichment Analysis of Differentially Expressed Genes (DEGs) using KEGG Pathway Enrichment
tasks.Description: This task aims to identify biological pathways or functions that are enriched within a set of DEGs. It typically utilizes pathway databases (e.g., KEGG)  and statistical methods (e.g., hypergeometric test) to determine whether specific pathways are over-represented among the DEGs.

tasks.Name: Calculation of Ferroptosis Pathway Activity Score using AUCell
tasks.Description: This task calculates cell-specific activity scores for a defined ferroptosis pathway based on the expression of relevant genes. The AUCell package is used to determine the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC) for each cell, providing a quantitative metric of pathway activity.

tasks.Name: Correlation Analysis between Ferroptosis Activity Score and Gene Expression
tasks.Description: This task assesses the relationship between ferroptosis pathway activity scores and the expression levels of individual genes. It typically involves calculating correlation coefficients (e.g., Spearman correlation) to identify genes whose expression is strongly associated with ferroptosis activity. The objective is to identify Ferroptosis markers.

tasks.Name: snATAC-seq Data Processing, Quality Control, and Peak Calling using Signac
tasks.Description: This task encompasses processing snATAC-seq data to filter low-quality cells and identify accessible chromatin regions (peaks). It includes filtering by the number of reads in peaks and blacklist regions and performs peak calling to obtain a set of genomic regions that are accessible.

tasks.Name: Chromatin Accessibility Analysis to Identify Differential Accessible Regions (DARs)
tasks.Description: This task identifies regions with altered chromatin accessibility related to disease states or cell types. It employs tools like Seurat's FindMarkers to identify significantly differentially accessible peaks between conditions or clusters.

tasks.Name: Construction of cis-coaccessibility Networks (CCANs) with Cicero
tasks.Description: This task utilizes the Cicero algorithm to construct networks of cis-regulatory elements (e.g., enhancers) that are co-accessible within a single cell population, elucidating the interactions of regulatory regions.

tasks.Name: Gene Regulatory Network (GRN) Inference and Analysis with pySCENIC
tasks.Description: This task involves constructing a GRN to identify transcription factors (TFs) and their target genes using methods such as the GRNboost2 algorithm. It can be used to identify key TFs regulating ferroptosis-related genes.

tasks.Name: Pseudotime Trajectory Analysis and Visualization using Monocle2
tasks.Description: This task involves performing pseudotime trajectory analysis to study cell developmental trajectories. DEGs are identified. The method applies dimensionality reduction as well as cell ordering to generate trajectories. Visualization with plot_cell_trajectory() is used.

tasks.Name: RNA Velocity Analysis with scVelo
tasks.Description: This task uses RNA velocity analysis to predict the future state of cells based on splicing dynamics. Velocity vectors are computed and visualized on a UMAP plot.

tasks.Name: Cell Communication Analysis
tasks.Description: This task involves the analysis of cell-cell communication based on ligand-receptor interactions. Functions from the CellChatDB database can be used to infer the communication network.

tasks.Name: Single-cell RNA-seq Differential Expression Analysis with Seurat
tasks.Description: Identify differentially expressed genes (DEGs) between cell clusters or conditions using Seurat's FindAllMarkers or similar functions. Input: Seurat object containing single-cell RNA-seq data, cluster identities or condition labels, and the parameters for the differential expression test (e.g., Wilcoxon rank-sum test). Output: A table of DEGs, including gene names, log fold changes, p-values, and adjusted p-values.

tasks.Name: Dimensionality Reduction and Clustering of Single-Cell RNA-seq Data using Seurat's workflow
tasks.Description: Perform dimensionality reduction and clustering on scRNA-seq data. Input: Gene expression matrix of scRNA-seq data and expected downstream parameters. Output: UMAP plots and clustering results for cell type identification (cluster identities).

tasks.Name: Single-cell ATAC-seq peak calling and differential accessibility analysis with Signac
tasks.Description: Call peaks and perform differential accessibility analysis. Input: Cell-by-bin count matrix and expected downstream parameters. Output: Peaks and marker genes that are used for identification of cell types.

tasks.Name: Trajectory Analysis/Pseudo-time Ordering with Monocle or scVelo
tasks.Description: Construct trajectories of cells to discover developmental transitions. Input: Seurat object containing single-cell RNA-seq data. Output: Trajectory plot and pseudo-time related data for each cell type.

tasks.Name: Integration of multi-omics (scRNA-seq, scATAC-seq, spatial transcriptomics) datasets
tasks.Description: Integrate and visualize multi-omics datasets which are often used in this paper. Input: different omics datasets. Output: a integrated dataset that allows researchers to make deeper connections.

tasks.Name: Gene Ontology (GO) analysis
tasks.Description: Finding GO terms for a given gene list. Input: a list of genes. Output: GO terms.

tasks.Name: LD score regression to identify enrichment of GWAS signals in cell type-specific ATAC-seq peaks
tasks.Description: Identify enrichment of GWAS signals. Input: GWAS summary statistics and ATAC-seq peaks. Output: enrichment results.
